intro: Anthemis brachmanni, commonly known as the Brachmann's tansy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its yellow-orange flowers are composed of ray and disk florets, typical of the family. Anthemis brachmanni is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
